abstract: Morgan Stanley settles with state of Mississippi for failing to reasonably supervise financial broker Steve Wyatt, whose erratic trades allegedly lost his clients around $50 million; settlement bars Wyatt and his supervisor, Ridgeland, Miss, branch manager Fred Brister, from securities industry for life and creates $4.2 million reimbursement fund; bank, which is in arbitration with dozens of Wyatt's former clients, asserts customers were negligent for trusting him, even though managers were aware of his bizarre behavior.
lead_paragraph: Although it had been alerted to problems, the company allowed a troubled financial adviser to manage tens of millions of dollars of clients’ money.
snippet: Although it had been alerted to problems, the company allowed a troubled financial adviser to manage tens of millions of dollars of clients’ money....

headline.main: Morgan Stanley Neglected Warnings on Broker
headline.print_headline: Morgan Stanley Neglected Warnings on Broker
